content:
GeneralTransform3D Class

Definition

Provides generalized transformation support for 3-D objects.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.None, Readability=System.Windows.Readability.Unreadable)]
public abstract class GeneralTransform3D : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable, IFormattable

Remarks

Transformations between 3-D objects take place through the TransformToAncestor and TransformToDescendant methods, both of which return a GeneralTransform3D object. In the case that the transformation between the 3-D objects may be represented by a 4x4 matrix, the methods return an instance of the MatrixTransform3D class. The GeneralTransform3D class can transform a Point3D to a Point3D and a Rect3D to a Rect3D.

GeneralTransform3D is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this GeneralTransform3D, making deep copies of this object's values.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D Clone ();
Returns
GeneralTransform3D

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

Clone is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this GeneralTransform3D object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
GeneralTransform3D

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

CloneCurrentValue is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

TransformBounds(Rect3D)

When overridden in a derived class, transforms the specified 3-D bounding box and returns an axis-aligned 3-D bounding box that is exactly large enough to contain it.

public abstract System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D TransformBounds (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D rect);
Parameters
rect
Rect3D

The 3-D bounding box to transform.

Returns
Rect3D

The smallest axis-aligned 3-D bounding box possible that contains the transformed rect.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

TransformBounds is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

TryTransform(Point3D, Point3D)

When overridden in a derived class, attempts to transform the specified 3-D point and returns a value that indicates whether the transformation was successful.

public abstract bool TryTransform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D inPoint, out System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D result);
Parameters
inPoint
Point3D

The 3-D point to transform.

result
Point3D

The result of transforming inPoint.

Returns
Boolean

true if inPoint was transformed; otherwise, false.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

Unlike the Transform method, this method does not throw an exception if the transformation is unsuccessful.

TryTransform is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the GeneralTransform3D instance is cast to an IFormattable interface.

IFormattable.ToString is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.
